clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For treatment of adenosine deaminase deficiency

contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Used to replace deficient or inactive adenosine deaminase which leads to severe combined immunodeficiency disease SCID The enzyme is responsible for converting adenosine to inosine In the absence of adenosine deaminase the purine substrates adenosine 2 deoxyadenosine and their metabolites are actually toxic to lymphocytes thereby leading to diminished immune function

incompatibilities.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Pentostatin can be decreased when used in combination with Pegademase
The therapeutic efficacy of Pegademase can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfa 2a
The therapeutic efficacy of Pegademase can be decreased when used in combination with Pegfilgrastim
The therapeutic efficacy of Pegademase can be decreased when used in combination with Peginterferon alfa 2b
